choices.E: the same address for multiple devices in the group
choices.D: a unique IPv6 address for each device in the group
choices.F: delivery of packets to the group interface that is closest to the sending device

questions.answer_description:
A new address type made specifically for IPv6 is called the Anycast Address. These IPv6 addresses are global addresses, these addresses can be assigned to more than one interface unlike an IPv6 unicast address. Anycast is designed to send a packet to the nearest interface that is a part of that anycast group.
The sender creates a packet and forwards the packet to the anycast address as the destination address which goes to the nearest router. The nearest router or interface is found by using the metric of a routing protocol currently running on the network. However, in a LAN setting the nearest interface is found depending on the order the neighbors were learned. The anycast packet in a LAN setting forwards the packet to the neighbor it learned about first.
questions.question_text: Which three are characteristics of an IPv6 anycast address? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BEF
The three characteristics of an IPv6 anycast address are:

B. Delivery of packets to the group interface that is closest to the sending device.
E. The same address for multiple devices in the group.
F. One-to-nearest communication model.

choices.B: delivery of packets to the group interface that is closest to the sending device.
choices.D: a unique IPv6 address for each device in the group.
choices.E: the same address for multiple devices in the group.

Refer to the exhibit. Which WAN protocol is being used?

discussion.content: “Show interface pos8/0/0” command showing LMI enq sent which show frame-relay encapsulation enabled on this interface. Cisco supports three different Local Management Interface (LMI) types for Frame Relay: Cisco, ANSI Annex D, and Q933-A Annex A http://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=170741&seqNum=3

The PVC STATUS displays the status of the PVC. The DCE device creates and sends the report to the DTE devices. There are 4 statuses:
ACTIVE: the PVC is operational and can transmit data 
INACTIVE: the connection from the local router to the switch is working, but the connection to the remote router is not available
DELETED: the PVC is not present and no LMI information is being received from the Frame Relay switch 
STATIC: the Local Management Interface (LMI) mechanism on the interface is disabled (by using the no keepalive command). This status is rarely seen.

questions.question_text: The output of the show frame-relay pvc command shows "PVC STATUS=INACTIVE". What does this mean?

choices.D: The PVC is configured correctly on the local switch, but there is a problem on the remote end of the PVC.
choices.B: The PVC is configured correctly, is operating normally, and is no longer actively seeking the address the remote route.
choices.E: The PVC is not configured on the switch.
choices.C: The PVC is configured correctly, is operating normally, and is waiting for interesting to trigger a call to the remote router.
choices.A: The PVC is configured correctly and is operating normally, but no data packets have been detected for more than five minutes.

questions.question_text: Which command is used to enable CHAP authentication, with PAP as the fallback method, on a serial interface?

choices.A: Router(config-if)# ppp authentication chap fallback ppp
choices.D: Router(config-if)# authentication ppp chap pap C
choices.B: Router(config-if)# authentication ppp chap fallback ppp
